Doctor Evidence Provides Grant for University of Southern California's Digital Fellow on Advancing Digital Health Solutions
Nationâ€™s First Digital Health Fellowship Created at USC Center for Body Computing
SANTA MONICA, Calif., June 9, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Doctor Evidence, a leading evidence-based medicine company, announced today it will provide a grant to the University of Southern California (USC) Center for Body Computing (CBC) for the nation's first Digital Health Fellowship in the U.S. The 1-year Fellowship is a first of its kind digital health research and clinical training program developed at the CBC. Dr. Andrew Keibel, who is a recent graduate of the Keck Medicine of USC's Internal Medicine Residency Program, was chosen as the first Fellow. He will work on the CBC's innovative solutions for improving doctor/patient shared decision-making and collaboration through connected care health applications using data provided by Doctor Evidence (DRE).
"For the last 12 years, we've led the country's top university-based research and strategic development partnerships for digital health, wearable tech and medical apps, so creating a Fellowship specifically for digital health was a natural next step," said Leslie Saxon, MD, founder and executive director of the USC CBC and the Fellowship supervisor. "We're grateful to the generous support provided by Doctor Evidence to make this happen."
